result.execSummary:
The defendant David Dean Stowell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  *Bond of $150.00 on file will be applied and the balance to be paid on a payment plan of $50.00 per month, commencing August 1, 2016.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Dean Stowell

records.addlTxt: in Custody MASO = paid in full

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Letter from Defendant dated 9/2016
Request Denied at this time.
Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant David Dean Stowell in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that he did meet with the defendant and an offer was provided.  In speaking with the defendant before court, the defendant would like to accept that offer.    Atty Hendee states plea agreement.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant wants to proceed without and enters a No Contest plea.     Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.    Atty Hendee relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty.

Atty Hendee asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.

BY THE COURT:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge

  Defendant agrees to the $15.00 payment plan fee.
Payment Plan:  $50.00/month commencing in August 1, 2016
Return date on June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant David Dean Stowell in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that an offer was provided to the defendant.  Defendant wants to accept the offer; however, he would like the fine lowered.  Court advises the defendant that it is the offer and either he accepts it or not.  
Atty Hendee states that he will speak with the defendant regarding the offer.
BY THE COURT:  Recess

BACK ON THE RECORD:
Court questions the defendant.  Defendant would like to accept the offer.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.    Defendant waives their right to an attorney.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant asks for a reset.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.  Return date scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
Return date on May 20, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Return date on May 13, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Pre-trial conference at 03-08-2016 01:15 pm.
Return date at 04-19-2016 11:15 am.

Pre-trial conference at 03-08-2016 01:15 pm.
Return date at 04-19-2016 11:15 am.

Defendant David Dean Stowell in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court confirms the defendant's address.  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.  Court finds proable cause to proceed.  

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.   Defendant waives their right to an attorney in order to have a conference with the District Attorney.    Court finds waiver made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return / Pre-Trial  Return date scheduled for April 19, 2016 at 11:15 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
